args.natural_language_statement: Let D(n) be the set of all diagonal matrices in GL(n). Show that D(n) is a matrix group.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap

/-- Let D(n) be the set of all diagonal matrices in GL(n). Show that D(n) is a matrix group. -/
theorem isSubgroup_set_diagonal_GL (n : Type u) [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n] [CommRing R] :
    IsSubgroup (Set.range (toMatrix' (Matrix.GeneralLinearGroup n R))) := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {R : Type _} [CommRing R] {n : Type _} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

open Matrix

/-- The set D(n) of diagonal invertible matrices (viewed as units of the matrix algebra). -/
def diagonal_units : Set (Units (Matrix n n R)) := { u | ∀ i j, i ≠ j → (↑u : Matrix n n R) i j = 0 }

/-- D(n) is a subgroup of GL(n,R) (the group of units of the matrix algebra). -/
theorem diagonal_units_is_subgroup : IsSubgroup (diagonal_units : Set (Units (Matrix n n R))) := by sorry
